Following are analysts' comments on his decision and its implications for Prime Minister David Cameron : LABOUR PARTY LEADER ED MILIBAND Labour has been saying for some months that there are real questions about Andy Coulson 's ability to do his job given the cloud of allegations hanging over him. We think he should have gone earlier. He has now done the right thing. I think there are questions about David Cameron 's judgement, about hanging on to him as long as he did. TIM BALE, PROFESSOR OF POLITICS, UNIVERSITY OF SUSSEX "It's obviously damaging because Andy Coulson was a very effective media operator so he is losing someone who was incredibly useful to the David Cameron operation

WASHINGTON, Feb. 7( UPI)-- President Bush U.S. Defense Donald Rumsfeld Donald Rumsfeld is conceding "it's possible" too few troops were sent to invade Iraq. In a war, many things cost lives, Donald Rumsfeld told ABC in an interview to be broadcast on "Nightline" Monday. President Bush has written that the troop level in Iraq was "the most important failure in the execution of the war."
